Class StdStat

  • java.lang.Object
    • StdStat
  • public class StdStat
extends java.lang.Object
    This file is meant to go above the already developed StdStats by introducing polynomial regression, linear regression, numpy inspired array creation, and various statistical functions like z-scores, variance, standard deviation, correlation coefficients, etc.

      Constructors

      StdStat()

                               double end,

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        predicted y-values

      • predict

        public static double[] predict​(double start,
                               double end,
                               int num,
                               double[] coeffs,
                               boolean endpoints)
        Predict for endpoints disabled, if not then refer to regular
        Parameters:
        start - deired start of x-values
        end - desired end of x-values
        num - number of x-points
        coeffs - array of coefficients of regression
        endpoints - whether or not to include the "end" as an endpoint
        Returns:
        predicted y-values

      • linSpace

        public static double[] linSpace​(double start,
                                double end,
                                int num)
        Inspired by numpy.linspace, create array of length num, starting with start, and ending with end
        Parameters:
        start - desired start of array
        end - desired end of array
        num - number of points in array
        Returns:
        array of [start, end] with "num" points

      • linSpace

        public static double[] linSpace​(double start,
                                double end,
                                int num,
                                boolean endpoints)
        Create array of length num, starting with start, and ending one less step than end
        Parameters:
        start - desired start of array
        end - desired end of array
        num - number of points in array
        endpoints - whether to include "end" as endpoint
        Returns:
        array of [start, end] or [start, end) with "num" points
